title: Host Header injection in oslo.io (using X-Forwarded-For header) leading to email spoofing
content:
Hello team
I hope it will be a happy year for you and for me 😇
Summary:
I found Host Header injection in oslo.io

I tried to use it to show the security effect on users And I found this
Steps To Reproduce:
<image_0>
So we will use X-Forwarded-Host: example.com
Impact
Many things can be done, including deceiving the user and referring to something else or a login page and stealing their account
There is a lot of information about it here :
https://portswigger.net/web-security/host-header
steps: Identify the target website oslo.io and determine it is vulnerable to Host Header injection.
Use the X-Forwarded-Host header to manipulate the Host Header, e.g., X-Forwarded-Host: example.com.
vuln_description: The vulnerability involves Host Header injection in oslo.io via the X-Forwarded-Host header, which can lead to email spoofing and other malicious activities such as redirecting users to fake login pages to steal credentials.
reason: The attack is straightforward and involves a common web vulnerability (Host Header injection) with a well-known exploitation method (using X-Forwarded-Host). There are no complex interactions or novel logic required.
